title: Comcast Expands Unlimited Calling to Denver
text:
Comcast Expands Unlimited Calling to Denver Use your key for the next article Comment 
According to the U.S. Census and Pew Hispanic Center , Colorado’s population continues to grow more diverse — in fact, Denver has one of the highest percentages of Mexican residents in the U.S. Each year, these families and families across the country are spending billions of dollars on cell phone charges related to international calling and millions more on worldwide calling cards just to stay connected. 
However, an updated plan, set to become available to Denver-area customers in August will make it easier and more affordable for the Denverites to stay internationally connected. 
This week, Comcast announced the addition of five new countries — India, China, Hong Kong, Singapore, South Korea and Mexico — to its popular home phone plan Xfinity Voice Unlimited. A plan that already covers calls to Canada, Puerto Rico, Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, U.S. Virgin Islands and American Samoa. The change comes at no additional cost, has the potential to save users hundreds of dollars each year and connects nearly half the world’s population. 
“Staying in touch with family and friends is important, regardless of geography. But sometimes even the shortest phone conversations can get expensive,” said Patti Loyack, vice president of Broadband Voice for Comcast . “We hope the changes we’re making to Xfinity Voice Unlimited helps more people stay connected for less money.” 
Unlimited international calling is just one way families are saving money. In fact, customers can also use the Xfinity connect app to make and receive calls and texts for free from a smartphone, tablet, or device connected to Wi-Fi.
